snippet: Workers in Brooklyn supermarkets have accused their employers of unfair conditions, a fight pitting Latino workers against South Korean store owners.
abstract: Workers in Brooklyn supermarkets have accused their employers of unfair conditions, a fight pitting Latino workers against South Korean store owners; organizers have sought to unionize or have filed lawsuits seeking wages; store owners say they are being unfairly singled out by the mostly Latino workers in the latest example of a long history of prejudice against Korean stores in New York City.
lead_paragraph: Workers in Brooklyn supermarkets have accused their employers of unfair conditions, a fight pitting Latino workers against South Korean store owners.

headline.seo: Union Efforts Over Conditions at Greengrocers Splits 2 Immigrant Groups
headline.main: Union Efforts Over Conditions at Grocers Split 2 Immigrant Groups
headline.print_headline: Labor Efforts Over Conditions at Greengrocers Split 2 Immigrant Groups

keywords.value: Korean American Small Business Service Center of New York
keywords.name: organizations
